alert.note: Alert for Colleton; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 8:27PM EDT until August 16 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR COLLETON AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 823 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Islandton to Stokes. Although rain has temporarily diminished a bit over the warned area, more heavy rain will move in from the west over the next half hour. As much as 4 to 7.5 inches of rain has already fallen and an additional 2 to 4 inches could fall through 930 PM. Flash flooding is likely in some areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Walterboro, Canadys, Sidney, Hiotts, Colleton Medical Center, Rhodes Crossroads and Stokes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
